Sentencas: In this paper, an integrated system is proposed for the production of turquoise hydrogen from methane cracking using solar energy.
Titulo: Energy and exergy analysis of an integrated system with solar methane cracking and co-electrolysis of CO2/H2O for efficient carbon management

Sentencas: The produced hydrogen and carbon by-products are used in fuel cells to generate clean electricity.
Titulo: Energy and exergy analysis of an integrated system with solar methane cracking and co-electrolysis of CO2/H2O for efficient carbon management

Sentencas: Syngas is produced through power generated via photovoltaics, using a solid oxide electrolyzer cell (SOEC).
Titulo: Energy and exergy analysis of an integrated system with solar methane cracking and co-electrolysis of CO2/H2O for efficient carbon management

Sentencas: The SOEC co-electrolyzes the exhaust CO2 from the direct carbon fuel cell, along with H2O.
Titulo: Energy and exergy analysis of an integrated system with solar methane cracking and co-electrolysis of CO2/H2O for efficient carbon management

Sentencas: The resulting syngas is subsequently converted into methanol.
Titulo: Energy and exergy analysis of an integrated system with solar methane cracking and co-electrolysis of CO2/H2O for efficient carbon management

Sentencas: The system is modelled using Aspen Plus to obtain the thermodynamic evaluation.
Titulo: Energy and exergy analysis of an integrated system with solar methane cracking and co-electrolysis of CO2/H2O for efficient carbon management

Sentencas: Mass, energy, entropy, and exergy balances are performed over the system's units.
Titulo: Energy and exergy analysis of an integrated system with solar methane cracking and co-electrolysis of CO2/H2O for efficient carbon management

Sentencas: The energy and exergy efficiency of the subsystems is determined, with solar methane cracking system achieving energy and exergy efficiencies of 82.2% and 92.5%, respectively.
Titulo: Energy and exergy analysis of an integrated system with solar methane cracking and co-electrolysis of CO2/H2O for efficient carbon management

Sentencas: The overall system produces methanol and generates 7.71 MW of electricity with the overall energy and exergy efficiencies of 40.6% and 37.5%, respectively.(c) 2023
Titulo: Energy and exergy analysis of an integrated system with solar methane cracking and co-electrolysis of CO2/H2O for efficient carbon management
